trans-unit.source: Validate Port Mirroring
trans-unit.target: Validate Port Mirroring

trans-unit.source: This article is relevant only if you deploy ATA Gateways instead of ATA Lightweight Gateways.
trans-unit.target: This article is relevant only if you deploy ATA Gateways instead of ATA Lightweight Gateways.

trans-unit.source: To determine if you need to use ATA Gateways, see [Choosing the right gateways for your deployment](/advanced-threat-analytics/plan-design/ata-capacity-planning#choosing-the-right-gateway-type-for-your-deployment).
trans-unit.target: To determine if you need to use ATA Gateways, see [Choosing the right gateways for your deployment](/advanced-threat-analytics/plan-design/ata-capacity-planning#choosing-the-right-gateway-type-for-your-deployment).

trans-unit.source: The following steps walk you through the process for validating that port mirroring is properly configured.
trans-unit.target: The following steps walk you through the process for validating that port mirroring is properly configured.

trans-unit.source: For ATA to work properly, the ATA Gateway must be able to see the traffic to and from the domain controller.
trans-unit.target: For ATA to work properly, the ATA Gateway must be able to see the traffic to and from the domain controller.

trans-unit.source: The main data source used by ATA is deep packet inspection of the network traffic to and from your domain controllers.
trans-unit.target: The main data source used by ATA is deep packet inspection of the network traffic to and from your domain controllers.

trans-unit.source: For ATA to see the network traffic, port mirroring needs to be configured.
trans-unit.target: For ATA to see the network traffic, port mirroring needs to be configured.

trans-unit.source: Port mirroring copies the traffic from one port (the source port) to another port (the destination port).
trans-unit.target: Port mirroring copies the traffic from one port (the source port) to another port (the destination port).

trans-unit.source: Validate port mirroring using a Windows PowerShell script
trans-unit.target: Validate port mirroring using a Windows PowerShell script

trans-unit.source: Save the text of this script into a file called *ATAdiag.ps1*.
trans-unit.target: Save the text of this script into a file called *ATAdiag.ps1*.

trans-unit.source: Run this script on the ATA Gateway that you want to validate.
trans-unit.target: Run this script on the ATA Gateway that you want to validate.

trans-unit.source: The script generates ICMP traffic from the ATA Gateway to the domain controller and looks for that traffic on the Capture NIC on the domain controller.
trans-unit.target: The script generates ICMP traffic from the ATA Gateway to the domain controller and looks for that traffic on the Capture NIC on the domain controller.

trans-unit.source: If the ATA Gateway sees ICMP traffic with a destination IP address the same as the DC IP addressed you entered in the ATA Console, it deems port mirroring configured.
trans-unit.target: If the ATA Gateway sees ICMP traffic with a destination IP address the same as the DC IP addressed you entered in the ATA Console, it deems port mirroring configured.

trans-unit.target: Sample for how to run the script:

trans-unit.source: Validate port mirroring using Net Mon
trans-unit.target: Validate port mirroring using Net Mon

trans-unit.source: Install [Microsoft Network Monitor 3.4](http://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=4865) on the ATA Gateway that you want to validate..
trans-unit.target: Install [Microsoft Network Monitor 3.4](http://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=4865) on the ATA Gateway that you want to validate..

trans-unit.source: Do not install Microsoft Message Analyzer, or any other traffic capture software on the ATA Gateway.
trans-unit.target: Do not install Microsoft Message Analyzer, or any other traffic capture software on the ATA Gateway.

trans-unit.source: Open Network Monitor and create a new capture tab.
trans-unit.target: Open Network Monitor and create a new capture tab.

trans-unit.source: Select only the **Capture** network adapter or the network adapter that is connected to the switch port that is configured as the port mirroring destination.
trans-unit.target: Select only the **Capture** network adapter or the network adapter that is connected to the switch port that is configured as the port mirroring destination.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that P-Mode is enabled.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that P-Mode is enabled.

trans-unit.source: Click **New Capture**.
trans-unit.target: Click **New Capture**.

trans-unit.source: Create new capture tab image
trans-unit.target: Create new capture tab image

trans-unit.source: In the Display Filter window, enter the following filter: **KerberosV5 OR LDAP** and then click **Apply**.
trans-unit.target: In the Display Filter window, enter the following filter: **KerberosV5 OR LDAP** and then click **Apply**.

trans-unit.source: Apply KerberosV5 or LDAP filter image
trans-unit.target: Apply KerberosV5 or LDAP filter image

trans-unit.source: Click **Start** to start the capture session.
trans-unit.target: Click **Start** to start the capture session.

trans-unit.source: If you do not see traffic to and from the domain controller, review your port mirroring configuration.
trans-unit.target: If you do not see traffic to and from the domain controller, review your port mirroring configuration.

trans-unit.source: Start capture session image
trans-unit.target: Start capture session image

trans-unit.source: It is important to make sure you see traffic to and from the domain controllers.
trans-unit.target: It is important to make sure you see traffic to and from the domain controllers.

trans-unit.source: If you only see traffic in one direction, you should work with your networking or virtualization teams to help troubleshoot your port mirroring configuration.
trans-unit.target: If you only see traffic in one direction, you should work with your networking or virtualization teams to help troubleshoot your port mirroring configuration.
